original: Aldberg, Johan, e. o. läroverksadjunkt, Motala, f. 8/2/05 i Oviken, Jämtl. 1., av hemm:äg. Anders Johansson o. Thilda J. G. 45 m. Ingegerd Laven. Barn: Anders f. 46. — Stud:-ex. i Östersund 27, fil. mag. 34, prov-år v. h. a. 1. i Bromma 41-42. Lär. v. Ölands folkhögsk. 35-36, vik. o. e. adj. v. Hvitfeldtska h. a. 1. i Gbg 36-38, e. adj. i Skellefteå 38-41, Sundsvall 42-44, e. o. adj. där 45, dito i Motala sed. 45. Res. t. Norge 32, Tyskl. 38.
translated: Aldberg, Johan, temporary high school assistant teacher, Motala, born February 8th, 1905 in Oviken, Jämtland province, son of home owner Anders Johansson and Thilda J. G.  Married to Ingegerd Laven in 1945. They have a son, Anders born in 1946. Johan studied at Östersund and obtained his degree in 1927. In 1934, he obtained a Bachelor of Arts and later worked as a substitute teacher in Bromma from 1941-1942. He taught at Ölands folkhögsk from 1935-1936, was a temporary and permanent assistant teacher at Hvitfeldtska high school in Göteborg from 1936-1938, and then became an assistant teacher in Skellefteå from 1938-1941, Sundsvall from 1942-1944. He was a temporary assistant teacher in Sundsvall in 1945, before accepting the same position in Motala where he remained from 1945 onwards. He traveled to Norway in 1932 and Germany in 1938.
